messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A supermarket is a big shop that sells food and other things.  
Packaging is the paper, plastic or box around the things we buy.  
Many supermarkets did bad things in the past ten years.  
They threw away a lot of food.  
They paid the people who made the food not enough money.  
They used too much plastic in their packaging.  
This hurt our environment.  
Now supermarkets start to notice.  
Customers are angry because they see so much plastic.  
So some big UK supermarkets said they will change.  
They will change their packaging.  
They will use less plastic.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6734 is too low, indicating a major loss of the core message about ‘major supermarket chains’ and a ‘pact promising to transform packaging’. FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8592 is below the required 0.90. Key terms such as ‘underpaid their suppliers’, ‘signed up to a pact’, ‘excessive plastic waste’, and ‘cut plastic wastage’ were simplified or omitted. Suggestion: Restore exact wording like ‘major supermarket chains’, ‘underpaid their suppliers’, ‘signed up to a pact’, and ‘cut plastic wastage’. Use precise phrases rather than overly generic substitutes.

They made excessive plastic waste in their packaging.

Text saved: A supermarket is a big shop that sells food.
In the last ten years, people made accusations of various unethical acts.
They wasted tonnes of food.
They paid the people who sold food to them too little.
They caused too much plastic waste in their packaging.
Packaging is the paper or plastic around things you buy.
This hurt our environment.
People are angry about so much plastic.
So some big UK supermarkets signed a pact.
The pact says they will change their packaging and cut plastic wastage.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7389 is below the required minimum of 0.75. Key detail is lost: the original mentions a growing consumer backlash against huge plastic waste, which is only hinted at as "People are angry about so much plastic." The promise to transform packaging is also weakened. Suggestion: Reintroduce "growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging" and clearly state that supermarkets "signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage."

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A ‘supermarket’ is a large shop that sells food.  
‘Packaging’ is the paper or plastic around things you buy.  
Many supermarket chains faced accusations of unethical acts over the past decade.  
They threw away tonnes of food.  
They paid suppliers too little money.  
They made huge amounts of plastic waste in their packaging.  
This hurt the environment.

The pact says they will change packaging.  
The pact says they will make less plastic waste.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A 'supermarket' is a large shop that sells food.  
'Packaging' is the paper or plastic around the things you buy.  
'pact' is a promise between people or groups.

Major supermarket chains did wrong things in the last ten years.  
They threw away tonnes of food.  
They paid suppliers too little money.  
They made a lot of plastic rubbish in their packaging.  
This hurt the environment.  
Consumers had a backlash against huge plastic rubbish from packaging.  
Then some of the largest UK supermarkets signed a pact.  
The pact promises to change packaging and cut plastic rubbish.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.718 is below the required threshold of 0.75.
Detected deviations:
- The phrase ‘‘came under fire with accusations of various unethical acts’’ is reduced to ‘‘did wrong things,’’ losing the nuance of public criticism and legal or moral charge.
- ‘‘excessive plastic waste generated by plastic packaging’’ is simplified to ‘‘made a lot of plastic rubbish in their packaging,’’ which loses the focus on the generation process and scale.
- The strong link between consumer backlash and supermarket agreement is weakened.
Suggestion: Retain key original phrases such as ‘‘came under fire with accusations’’ and ‘‘excessive plastic waste generated by packaging’’ to preserve the full meaning and context.
